markdown: <::attestation: Signature Signed Signature: legible Readable Text: Herbert A handwritten signature centered on a white background.::> <::logo: 81 August 16-21, 1981 San Diego, California A stylized grain plant is intertwined with a gridded globe featuring the numbers "81".::> XII INTERNATIONAL CONGRESS OF NUTRITION International Union of Nutritional Sciences 1629 K Street, N.W., Suite 700 Washington, D.C. 20006, U.S.A. (202) 296-8803 Cable: ICN-89-2407 Congress Officers President: George K. Davis Vice President: Samuel J. Fomon Vice President: Alfred E. Harper Secretary: John G. Bieri Treasurer: Mattie Rae S. Fox XII International Congress of Nutrition, August 16 - 21, 1981 Town and Country Hotel, San Diego, California, U.S.A. August 17 Workshop on "Interaction of Vitamin B₁₂ with Nutrients and Drugs" Presentation by Victor Herbert, M.D., J.D., Chief, Hematology and Nutrition Laboratory, Bronx VA Medical Center and Professor of Medicine, SUNY Downstate Medical Center will refer to the following material, and which, if confirmed by other workers, suggests that the $2-billion- a-year multivitamin/mineral industry may have to take vitamin B₁₂ out of their products: The abstract (see over) will be published in the October 1981 issue of "Clinical Research." Hosts: American Institute of Nutrition, American Society for Clinical Nutrition, U.S. National Academy of Sciences
